abstract: The color rendering intent in the graphics context’s graphics state.
overview:
## Discussion

A value that specifies the rendering intent currently used by the graphics context. For possible values, see [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorRenderingIntent]. The rendering intent specifies how Cocoa should handle colors that are not located within the gamut of the destination color space of a graphics context. If you do not explicitly set the rendering intent, and sampled images are being drawn, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext] uses perceptual rendering intent. Otherwise, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext] uses relative colorimetric rendering intent.

# colorRenderingIntent

**Instance Property**

The color rendering intent in the graphics context’s graphics state.

## Declaration

```swift
var colorRenderingIntent: NSColorRenderingIntent { get set }
```

## Discussion

A value that specifies the rendering intent currently used by the graphics context. For possible values, see [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorRenderingIntent]. The rendering intent specifies how Cocoa should handle colors that are not located within the gamut of the destination color space of a graphics context. If you do not explicitly set the rendering intent, and sampled images are being drawn, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext] uses perceptual rendering intent. Otherwise, [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGraphicsContext] uses relative colorimetric rendering intent.

## Managing Color Rendering

- **NSColorRenderingIntent**: Constants that specify how Cocoa should handle colors that are not located within the destination color space of a graphics context.
